intro: Carmichaelia enysii var. ambigua, commonly known as the Enysii kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
